New Records: 120 is the smallest total that India have defended in T20I and also the lowest target that Pakistan have failed to chase.
Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah took 3 wickets for 14 runs.
India defended 119 runs in a thrilling game.
Pakistan were 57-0 after ten overs but fell away in the second ten.
Pakistan needed 120 runs to win but fell short by 6 runs.
Rizwan and Zaman wickets were turning points in Pakistan’s innings.
Hardik Pandya bowled very well in the middle overs.
Jasprit Bumrah's penultimate over was crucial, going for just three runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma acknowledged that India didn't bat well enough and were 15-20 runs short.
Rohit Sharma praised the bowlers for their performance.
Rohit Sharma highlighted the never-say-die attitude in the team.
Rohit Sharma appreciated the crowd support.
Babar Azam reflected on Pakistan's failure to capitalize and too many dot balls.
Babar Azam mentioned the pressure and quick wickets as reasons for their loss.
Jasprit Bumrah expressed happiness with the crowd support and team's performance.
Jasprit Bumrah emphasized focusing on the present and sticking to processes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in New York.
The crowd support was significant, making it feel like a home game for India.
The game was part of the T20 World Cup 2024.
